Class UpdateAppointmentController

java.lang.Object
Controllers.UpdateAppointmentController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class UpdateAppointmentController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Project: C195Assessment Package: java.Controllers // Controller for updating the appointment

User: Karson Gover Date: 02/08/2023 Time: 4:22 PM

Created with IntelliJ IDEA

This controller class is responsible for updating appointments in the mySQL database.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      This initializer method sets values in the tableview, combo boxes, and text fields by calling SQL queries.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • onUpdateButton

      public void onUpdateButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException, IOException
      This method is called when the update button is clicked. It updates the appointment in the database after checking all input fields for validity.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Action Event
      Throws:
      SQLException - SQLException
      IOException - IOException

    • onBackButton

      public void onBackButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method is called when the back button is clicked. It returns to the mains screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Action Event
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException

    • allFieldsFilled

      public boolean allFieldsFilled()
      This method checks if all text boxes/selections are filled.
      Returns:
      Returns true if all values are filled, false if otherwise.

    • checkIfCustomerExists

      public static boolean checkIfCustomerExists(int customerID) throws SQLException
      This method checks if the given customer exists.
      Parameters:
      customerID - The ID of the customer that is being validated.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the SQL query returns a row of the existing customer, returns false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - SQLException

    • startEndCompare

      public boolean startEndCompare()
      This method checks if the start time of the appointment is after or equal to the end time.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the start time of the appointment is after or equal to the end time, false otherwise.

    • checkOverlapTimes

      public boolean checkOverlapTimes(int id, int appointmentID, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end) throws SQLException
      This method executes a query that gets all appointment times of the specified customer, then compares those values with the start/end times of the appointment the user wants to add. If those two sets of times are overlapping, it throws an error that the user must fix.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the customer
      start - The start time of the appointment
      end - The end time of the appointment
      Returns:
      Returns true if the two sets of appointment times don't overlap, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - SQLException

    • checkIfWeekend

      public boolean checkIfWeekend(LocalDate date)
      This method checks if the date of the appointment the user want to add is on the weekend, which is outside business hours.
      Parameters:
      date - The date of the appointment the user wants to add
      Returns:
      Returns true if the day of the appointment lies on a weekend, false otherwise.
